required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator (ICD) Intracardiac Electrograms
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Observational Study of the ICD Intracardiac Electrograms for Prediction of Ventricular Tachyarrhythmias and Congestive Heart Failure

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether waveforms of the intracardiac electrograms, acquired through an ICD, can be used:
- to predict malignant ventricular arrhythmias, requiring appropriate ICD therapies, and
- to predict progression of heart failure in patients with ICD.

primary_outcome.measure: sustained ventricular tachycardia with appropriate ICD therapies (either shock or ATP)

secondary_outcome.measure: Composite heart failure outcome (HF hospitalization, HF death, heart transplant)

study_pop.textblock: Patients with ischemic or non-ischemic cardiomyopathy undergoing ICD implantation for primary or secondary prevention of sudden cardiac death

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- history of acute MI at least 4 weeks old
- non-ischemic LV dysfunction for at least 9 months
- who have an EF < or = to 35%
- who was resuscitated from sudden cardiac arrest (ventricular tachyarrhythmia)
- undergone implantation of an FDA-approved ICD for primary or secondary prevention of SCD
Exclusion Criteria:
- inability or unwillingness to provide valid informed consent
- pregnancy
- any condition other than cardiac disease that was associated with a high likelihood of death during 1 year after enrollment

facility.name: Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine
